item.title: Choosing the Right Tools For Your Data Pipeline
item.author: admin@andrewrgoss.com (Andrew Goss)
item.description: written by Start Data Engineering If you are building data pipelines from the ground up, the number of available data engineering tools to choose from can be overwhelming. If you are thinking: Most of the tools seem to be doing the same/similar thing, which one should I choose? How to choose the right tool for my data pipeline? Then this post is for you. item.title: Emerging Architectures for Modern Data Infrastructure
item.author: admin@andrewrgoss.com (Andrew Goss)
item.description: *Source: Andreessen Horowitz written by Matt Bornstein, Martin Casado, and Jennifer Li As an industry, we’ve gotten exceptionally good at building large, complex software systems. We’re now starting to see the rise of massive, complex systems built around data – where the primary business value of the system comes from the analysis of data, rather than the software directly. We’re seeing quick-moving impacts of this trend across the industry, including the emergence of new roles, shifts in customer spending, and the emergence of new startups providing infrastructure and tooling around data.
